com.restaurant.rakshith

Class ValidInputReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.restaurant.rakshith.ValidInputReader

  • public class ValidInputReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains useful static methods for reading user input. It makes sure that the input is "valid" for some definition of the term.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ValidInputReader() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double getValidDouble(java.lang.String prompt, double min, double max)
      Prompts the user to input a real number, reads and returns it, re-prompting as necessary until the number is in the given range.
      static java.io.File getValidFile(java.lang.String prompt, java.lang.String defaultFileName)
      Prompts the user to input a file name as a line of input as a string, reads and returns the corresponding File, re-prompting as necessary until the file exists and can be read.
      static int getValidInt(java.lang.String prompt, int min, int max)
      Prompts the user to input an integer, reads and returns it, re-prompting as necessary until the number is in the given range.
      static java.lang.String getValidString(java.lang.String prompt, java.lang.String regex)
      Prompts the user to input a line of input as a string, reads and returns it, re-prompting as necessary until the line matches the given regular expression.
      static boolean getYesNo(java.lang.String prompt)
      Prompts the user to input "y" or "n" case-insensitively as a string, re-prompting as necessary until the user has typed "y" or "n".
      static java.lang.String readEntireFile(java.io.File file)
      Reads the entire contents of the given file and return them as a String.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getValidDouble

        public static double getValidDouble(java.lang.String prompt,
                                    double min,
                                    double max)
        Prompts the user to input a real number, reads and returns it, re-prompting as necessary until the number is in the given range.
        Parameters:
        prompt - message to display while reading input
        min - minimum allowed value, inclusive
        max - maximum allowed value, inclusive
        Returns:
        the real number that was read; guaranteed to be between min and max inclusive
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if prompt is null or min > max

      • getValidInt

        public static int getValidInt(java.lang.String prompt,
                              int min,
                              int max)
        Prompts the user to input an integer, reads and returns it, re-prompting as necessary until the number is in the given range.
        Parameters:
        prompt - message to display while reading input
        min - minimum allowed value, inclusive
        max - maximum allowed value, inclusive
        Returns:
        the integer that was read; guaranteed to be between min and max inclusive
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if prompt is null or min > max

      • getValidString

        public static java.lang.String getValidString(java.lang.String prompt,
                                              java.lang.String regex)
        Prompts the user to input a line of input as a string, reads and returns it, re-prompting as necessary until the line matches the given regular expression.
        Parameters:
        prompt - message to display while reading input
        regex - regular expression that the line must match before returning
        Returns:
        the integer that was read; guaranteed to match the given regex
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if prompt or regex is null

      • getYesNo

        public static boolean getYesNo(java.lang.String prompt)
        Prompts the user to input "y" or "n" case-insensitively as a string, re-prompting as necessary until the user has typed "y" or "n". Returns a boolean value of true if the user typed "y" and false if "n".
        Parameters:
        prompt - message to display while reading input
        Returns:
        true if the user typed "y" or "Y"; false if the user typed "n" or "N"
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if prompt is null

      • getValidFile

        public static java.io.File getValidFile(java.lang.String prompt,
                                        java.lang.String defaultFileName)
        Prompts the user to input a file name as a line of input as a string, reads and returns the corresponding File, re-prompting as necessary until the file exists and can be read. Reads the file out of a JAR archive as well, if possible.
        Parameters:
        prompt - message to display while reading input
        defaultFileName - default file name that will be used if the user simply presses Enter (ignored if null)
        Returns:
        the file name typed; guaranteed to have existed and be readable at time of call
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if prompt is null

      • readEntireFile

        public static java.lang.String readEntireFile(java.io.File file)
                                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads the entire contents of the given file and return them as a String. Reads the file out of a JAR archive as well, if possible.
        Parameters:
        file - the file whose data should be read
        Returns:
        the entire contents of the file, as a long String
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file passed is null or does not exist
